messages.message:
Is there caching happening when we bundle solutions? I changed the .py file in the script, and the ibflowbin has the correct file, but when I try to run the solution, itâ€™s running as if it is still using the old file.

edit: When I increment the version in the package.json, it creates a new ibsolution that then runs properly.
are you running the .ibsolution files not from marketplace?
yeah, trying to get this resource folder working haha
I think solution files get unzipped into a tmp folder and the binary inside is run from there. I think after the run it gets removed? @Karthik S or @Mohit should be able to help you
For standalone solution runs (running from .ibsolution file), the ibflowbin is extracted in the tmp folder in the output directory of the flow run ( look at fn:  `_get_ibflowbin_path`).
oh i see haha sounds good

they are not removed (because the binary path is then passed upstream and everything becomes async from there). So, if the ibflowbin is already present, it will be reused. Two options you have: use run_id or delete the out folder.
cool good to know. as long as this is the expected behavior
Btw do we have any documentation on this?
